article:
, with lace, gold and silver ornaments]] A 'Dutch cap' or 'Dutch bonnet' is a
style of woman's hat associated with the various traditional Dutch woman's
costumes. Usually made of white cotton or lace, it is sometimes characterized by
triangular flaps or wings that turn up on either
side. [http://www.hvanrossum.com/costume.html Wearing a Dutch costume],
instructions for making iconic hat out of paper for a child's dress-up
costume. It can resemble some styles of nurse's
hat. [http://slhson.org/history.html St. Luke's Hospital School of Nursing
Historical Review], referring to the more usual style of nurse hat as a
"traditional Dutch cap".


Many parts of the Netherlands have their own traditional costumes.
